alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:29AM EDT until July 14 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL MORRIS AND SOUTH CENTRAL SUSSEX COUNTIES... At 729 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Hopatcong to Mountain Lakes to near Millburn, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, Hopatcong, Florham Park, East Hanover, Boonton, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mount Arlington, Mountain Lakes, Stanhope, Victory Gardens, Parsippany, Lake Telemark, Succasunna-Kenvil, White Meadow Lake and Hanover Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 30 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 49. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
